ArticleTitle.sentence: A novel mitogen-inducible gene product related to p50/p105-NF-kappa B participates in transactivation through a kappa B site.

event.clue: A novel mitogen-inducible gene product related to p50/p105-NF-kappa B participates in transactivation through a kappa B site.
A novel mitogen-inducible gene product related to p50/p105-NF-kappa B participates in transactivation through a kappa B site.
A novel mitogen-inducible gene product related to p50/p105-NF-kappa B participates in transactivation through a kappa B site.

AbstractText.sentence: A Rel-related, mitogen-inducible, kappa B-binding protein has been cloned as an immediate-early activation gene of human peripheral blood T cells.

event.clue: A Rel-related, mitogen-inducible, kappa B-binding protein has been cloned as an immediate-early activation gene of human peripheral blood T cells.
A Rel-related, mitogen-inducible, kappa B-binding protein has been cloned as an immediate-early activation gene of human peripheral blood T cells.

AbstractText.sentence: The cDNA has an open reading frame of 900 amino acids capable of encoding a 97-kDa protein.
This protein is most similar to the 105-kDa precursor polypeptide of p50-NF-kappa B.
Like the 105-kDa precursor, it contains an amino-terminal Rel-related domain of about 300 amino acids and a carboxy-terminal domain containing six full cell cycle or ankyrin repeats.
In vitro-translated proteins, truncated downstream of the Rel domain and excluding the repeats, bind kappa B sites.

event.clue: In vitro-translated proteins, truncated downstream of the Rel domain and excluding the repeats, bind kappa B sites.
In vitro-translated proteins, truncated downstream of the Rel domain and excluding the repeats, bind kappa B sites.

AbstractText.sentence: We refer to the kappa B-binding, truncated protein as p50B by analogy with p50-NF-kappa B and to the full-length protein as p97.

event.clue: We refer to the kappa B-binding, truncated protein as p50B by analogy with p50-NF-kappa B and to the full-length protein as p97.

AbstractText.sentence: p50B is able to form heteromeric kappa B-binding complexes with RelB, as well as with p65 and p50, the two subunits of NF-kappa B.

event.clue: p50B is able to form heteromeric kappa B-binding complexes with RelB, as well as with p65 and p50, the two subunits of NF-kappa B.
p50B is able to form heteromeric kappa B-binding complexes with RelB, as well as with p65 and p50, the two subunits of NF-kappa B.

AbstractText.sentence: Transient-transfection experiments in embryonal carcinoma cells demonstrate a functional cooperation between p50B and RelB or p65 in transactivation of a reporter plasmid dependent on a kappa B site.

event.clue: Transient-transfection experiments in embryonal carcinoma cells demonstrate a functional cooperation between p50B and RelB or p65 in transactivation of a reporter plasmid dependent on a kappa B site.

AbstractText.sentence: The data imply the existence of a complex family of NF-kappa B-like transcription factors.
